commit_list.message:
BUGFIX: bash colour codes need special care

Otherwise, we have a situation where status information can be
duplicated when two directories have similar names.
eg. .git has changed files, then .gitignore was shown with that status:
.git(????)
.git(????)ignore

rather than :
.git(????)
.gitignore

This patch fixes that issue, at least for bash.

commit_list.message:
Custom field support for Categories and Products

Categories and Fields can now have custom fields (defined in the
Settings tab) which are stored as a JSON hash within the database.

The fields can then be set via the relevant form, and retrieved using
<r:product:field name="" /> and <r:category:field name="" />.

Best described as a distributed database using data portability technologies. People will markup their blogs, websites, or store their information where they want - and ping the central SiliconBeachAustralia.org server to create an aggregated database of people and companies.

Fix: undefined local variable or method `e'

The example of using timezones from the README
(https://github.com/icalendar/icalendar#example) was causing the
following error :

 NameError:
   undefined local variable or method `e' for #<Icalendar::Event:0x007fc94f7a35f8>

This appears to be a leftover from 6a5bd05c - where the Event was
previously passed around as `e`, it should now use implicit `self`.

This commit makes the code use the implicit self, and adds a test case
which catches this error, based upon the code in the README.

repo_list.description: Active Merchant is a simple payment abstraction library used in and sponsored by Shopify. It is written by Tobias Luetke, Cody Fauser, and contributors. The aim of the project is to feel natural to Ruby users and to abstract as many parts as possible away from the user to offer a consistent interface across all supported gateways.
